clinical_notes: Patient presents with recurring headaches over the past 3 months, primarily in the frontal region. Headaches described as dull, constant ache lasting 2-4 hours. No visual disturbances or nausea reported. Previous imaging 2 years ago was unremarkable. Family history of migraines.

Chronic lower back pain with radiation to left leg. Pain worse with prolonged sitting. Conservative treatment including physical therapy for 6 weeks with minimal improvement. No bowel or bladder dysfunction. Prior lumbar surgery 10 years ago at L4-L5.

Follow-up imaging for 8mm pulmonary nodule identified on routine chest X-ray 3 months ago. Patient is former smoker (quit 5 years ago, 20 pack-year history). No respiratory symptoms. No weight loss. Previous imaging shows nodule was not present 2 years ago.

Acute onset right knee pain after twisting injury during recreational sports 1 week ago. Immediate swelling noted. Unable to fully extend knee. Positive Lachman test on physical exam. No prior knee injuries. Otherwise healthy, active lifestyle.

Palpable nodule in right thyroid lobe discovered on routine physical exam. Patient reports no dysphagia, voice changes, or neck pain. TSH within normal limits. No family history of thyroid cancer. No history of radiation exposure.
